resize

Resize a matrix.

Syntax

mat_rs = resize(mat, new_size)
mat_rs = resize(mat, new_size, interp_mode)

Description

resize resamples a matrix to a given size using interp1 (1D), interp2 (2D), or interp3 (3D).

Inputs

mat

 matrix to resize
new_size desired matrix size in elements given by [N] in 1D (a single number is used for both row and column vectors), [Nx, Ny] in 2D and [Nx, Ny, Nz] in 3D.

Optional Inputs

interp interpolation mode used by interp1, interp2, and interp3 (default = '*linear')

Outputs

mat_rs resized matrix

Examples

  • Loading External Image Maps
  • 2D Time Reversal For A Circular Sensor
  • Optimising k-Wave Performance

See Also

interp1, interp2, interp3
